summary: A letter from the Warden of the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York to Mark Epstein, informing him of the death of his brother, Jeffrey Edward Epstein, on August 10, 2019, at New York Presbyterian-Lower Manhattan Hospital, with the preliminary cause appearing to be suicide.

persons.name: Mark Epstein
persons.role: Recipient of condolence letter, brother of the deceased
persons.context: Addressed in a letter from the Warden, receiving condolences regarding the death of his brother, Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: Pronounced deceased on August 10, 2019, at a New York hospital, with the cause appearing to be suicide.

persons.name: Warden MCC New York
persons.role: Warden of the Metropolitan Correctional Center
persons.context: Author of the condolence letter to Mark Epstein, informing him of Jeffrey Epstein's death.

connections.description: Mark Epstein is the brother of Jeffrey Edward Epstein, as stated in the condolence letter.
The Warden was responsible for the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held prior to his death.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Edward Epstein was pronounced deceased at New York Presbyterian-Lower Manhattan Hospital. The preliminary cause appears to be suicide.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
Mark Epstein's address: 301 E. 66 Street, New York, NY, 10065
New York Presbyterian-Lower Manhattan Hospital, New York, New York
keyFacts: Jeffrey Edward Epstein died on August 10, 2019.
He was pronounced deceased at New York Presbyterian-Lower Manhattan Hospital.
The preliminary cause of death appeared to be suicide, though no exact cause was identified at the time of the letter.
The letter was sent from the Warden of the Metropolitan Correctional Center to Mark Epstein, Jeffrey's brother.
The document is an official condolence correspondence from the Bureau of Prisons.
